sen.j: 猪名県（いなのあがた）は古墳時代のヤマト王権の時代に現在の吹田市から尼崎市までの北摂に置かれた古代日本の地方官制地方官制のはじまり（アガタ）の一つ。
sen.e: Ina no Agata was one of the early form of the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan (Agata), which was placed in Hokusetsu (northern Settsu Province, the area covering now Suita City through Amagasaki City) during the Kofun period (tumulus period), the era of Yamato sovereignty.
sen.cmt: 地方官制地方官制: 誤字とみなし「地方官制」のみの訳です。
sen.e: Ina no Agata was one of the early form of the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan (Agata), which was placed in Hokusetsu (northern Settsu Province, the area covering now Suita City through Amagasaki City) during the Kofun period (tumulus period), the era of Yamato sovereignty.

Ina no Agata was one of the early form of the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan (Agata), which was placed in Hokusetsu (northern Settsu Province, the area covering now Suita City through Amagasaki City) during the Kofun period (tumulus period), the era of Yamato sovereignty.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: この猪名県が日本の歴史文献に登場するのは奈良時代に成立したとみられる日本の史書『日本書紀』である。
sen.e: Ina no Agata first appeared in the Japanese history book "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is thought to have been completed during the Nara period.
Ina no Agata first appeared in the Japanese history book "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is thought to have been completed during the Nara period.
Ina no Agata first appeared in the Japanese history book "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), which is thought to have been completed during the Nara period.

sen.j: 日本書記には、「仁徳天皇の頃に『佐伯部』（さえきべ）といわれる猪名県で形成され、近畿に属したヤマト王権の軍隊が仁徳天皇へ馬を召し上げた」と書かれており、古来から猪名県はヤマト王権と密接な関係にあったとみられている。
sen.e: Nihonshoki says "During the period of Emperor Nintoku, an army called "Saeki be" under Yamato sovereignty, which was formed by Ina no Agata and belonged to Kinki region, presented a horse to the Emperor," and therefore it is thought that Ina no Agata had a close relationship with Yamato sovereignty from ancient times.

Nihonshoki says 'During the period of Emperor Nintoku, an army called "Saekibe" under Yamato sovereignty, which was formed by Ina no Agata and belonged to Kinki region, presented a horse to the Emperor', and therefore it is thought that Ina no Agata had a close relationship with Yamato sovereignty from ancient times.
sen.cmt: 原文中の「」の部分が正しくありません。変更しています。Saeki be→スペース削除しました。コンマの位置が正しくありません、移動しました。
sen.e: Nihonshoki says 'During the period of Emperor Nintoku, an army called "Saekibe" under Yamato sovereignty, which was formed by Ina no Agata and belonged to Kinki region, presented a horse to the Emperor', and therefore it is thought that Ina no Agata had a close relationship with Yamato sovereignty from ancient times.

sen.j: また、当時高度な文明を持つ朝鮮から日本へ渡来してきた朝鮮民族もいたと伝わる。
sen.e: It is also said that in this Agata there were Korean people who came to Japan from Korea, a country with an advanced civilization in those days.
It is also said that in this Agata there were Korean people who came to Japan from Korea, a country with an advanced civilization in those days.
It is also said that in this Agata there were Korean people who came to Japan from Korea, a country with an advanced civilization in those days.

sen.j: この猪名県を支配していたのが、現在の大阪府箕面市石丸に存在する為那都比古神社の豪族であった「為那都比古一族」（いなつひこ）で、飛鳥時代に起こった天智天皇・藤原鎌足らが蘇我氏を滅ぼし（乙巳の変）、それに伴う改革である「大化の改新」以前に現在の北摂を支配していた国家が成立していたとみられる。
sen.e: Ina no Agata was controlled by "the Inatsuhiko family," gozoku (local ruling family) of Inatsuhiko Shrine located in now Ishimaru, Mino City, Osaka Prefecture, and it is thought that a state had been established in now Hokusetsu area before the Isshi Incident (when Emperor Tenchi and FUJIWARA no Kamatari destroyed the Soga family) and following Taika no Kaishin (Great Reformation of the Taika Era) occurred in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「乙巳の変」: the Isshi Incident
sen.e: Ina no Agata was controlled by 'the Inatsuhiko family', gozoku (local ruling family) of Inatsuhiko Shrine was located in now Ishimaru, Mino City, Osaka Prefecture, and it is thought that a state had been established in now Hokusetsu area before the Isshi Incident (when Emperor Tenchi and FUJIWARA no Kamatari destroyed the Soga family) and following 'Taika no Kaishin' (Great Reformation of the Taika Era) occurred in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 原文中の「」の部分が正しくありません。変更しています。コンマの位置が正しくありません、移動しました。located in→文法ミスです。変更しました。Taika no Kaishin→原文には「」がついています。追加しました。
sen.e: Ina no Agata was controlled by 'the Inatsuhiko family', gozoku (local ruling family) of Inatsuhiko Shrine was located in now Ishimaru, Mino City, Osaka Prefecture, and it is thought that a state had been established in now Hokusetsu area before the Isshi Incident (when Emperor Tenchi and FUJIWARA no Kamatari destroyed the Soga family) and following 'Taika no Kaishin' (Great Reformation of the Taika Era) occurred in the Asuka period.

sen.j: その後ヤマト王権の県主となった以後の3世紀から5世紀にかけて県が成立したとみられている。
sen.e: Therefore, the Agata seems to have been established from the third through fifth centuries after the family became Agatanushi (District Chieftain) under Yamato sovereignty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the Agata seems to have been established from the third through fifth centuries after the family became Agatanushi (District Chieftain) under Yamato sovereignty.
Therefore, the Agata seems to have been established from the third through fifth centuries after the family became Agatanushi (District Chieftain) under Yamato sovereignty.
Ina no Agatanushi (District Chieftain)
Ina no Agatanushi (District Chieftain)
Ina no Agatanushi (District Chieftain)

sen.j: 猪名県を支配した為那都比古一族は猪名県成立以後も支配を続け、末裔が県主となっていた。
sen.e: The Inatsuhiko family continued to control the area after Ina no Agata was established and descendants succeeded to Agatanushi.
The Inatsuhiko family continued to control the area after Ina no Agata was established and descendants succeeded to Agatanushi.
The Inatsuhiko family continued to control the area after Ina no Agata was established and descendants succeeded to Agatanushi.

sen.j: だが猪名県の県主は一切資料が現存おらず、詳細は分かっていない。
sen.e: However, details about Agatanushi of Ina no Agata are unknown because no materials have been kept to today.
However, details about Agatanushi of Ina no Agata are unknown because no materials have been kept to today.
